title: Far from fearing an election, curiously confident Jeremy Corbyn can almost taste power
text:
Some years ago, as an MP, I led a Parliamentary delegation to Central America and one of our party was Jeremy Corbyn. He impressed me as he knew as much as our hosts about local politics and government.

At the time, he was seen as rather a joke figure: an eccentric and largely harmless Leftist zealot who could always be relied upon to irritate the Labour whips and Blairite Ministers from his perch on the Labour backbenches. In his trademark Sinn Fein geography teacher jacket, he would opine on various fashionable liberation campaigns, British imperialism, trades union rights, the evils of US foreign policy and the like.

He was incurious of most domestic issues and appeared unconcerned at reconciling...
description: Some years ago, as an MP, I led a Parliamentary delegation to Central America and one of our party was Jeremy Corbyn.
